blog.name: dramaphan
blog.title: Yo I Comment On The Drama When Shit Hits The Fan
blog.description:
Phandom drama? It's more likely than you think.

.

My ask box is always open if you need a place to be dramatic, share theories, conspiracies, opinions, or general grievances. Fire away, my babies. Nothing is off limits. (Except for the things that are.)

.

Icon by phanniephobic, header by cinnamonnutlester

summary: Okayyyyyy and nowwwww people are mad he didn’t address the TBC dates which i understand but he said ‘for now’ for fucks sake...
question: Okayyyyyy and nowwwww people are mad he didn’t address the TBC dates which i understand but he said ‘for now’ for fucks sake they’ve addressed numerous times they’re still trying with it and they probably still are and just want to tell us when they’re 100% sure about the tbc dates. just calm down man. i get you’re upset about it but they’re TRYING
answer:
I honestly don’t get it.

These dates were marked TBC from the literal beginning. Months and months and months ago.

Y’all knew ages ago that there was a possibility those shows may or may not happen.

And yeah, I get that everyone wants to be informed. As soon as they get the go ahead, Dan and/or Phil will say something.

They’ve been hinting at it. Somethings coming. This tour isn’t over yet. They will announce the TBC dates as soon as they’re able to. People are just looking for something to be unnecessarily mad about.

title: A Year in the Life [2/12]
body:
Title: A Year in the Life

Summary: Everyone writes off 2012 as the year of ‘No Homo Howell’, implying that Dan’s demeanor was linked to stress over his sexuality and relationship with Phil. But that’s only the tip of the iceberg - with an unsteady future, undiagnosed mental illness, and suddenly thrust into the public eye, 2012 was a tumultuous year, one that no one has yet to truly understand.

Chapter: 2 - February

Word Count: 2.2k

Relationship: Dan Howell/Phil Lester

Rating: E

Chapter Warnings: n/a

Read on AO3 | January

2/6/2012 – 8:27 PM

Today was a good day, at least it ought to be. They had uploaded the first episode of the Super Amazing Project’s second season, after all. Phil, for one, was thrilled to see all their hard work pay off in a video he was proud of.

Dan was just…tired.

And Phil could understand it, he supposed. They had exerted more mental and physical energy than they otherwise would for a video, even more so considering how important the premiere was to them. But Dan looked like he had the wind taken out of his sails, like his soul departed from his body and only a zombie of himself remained. He watched the younger male sit on the couch with bowed shoulders, seemingly unable to keep focus. Phil frowned, sitting down by his side and gently resting his hand between his shoulder blades. “Hey, do you want some tea? Maybe go take a bath?” he offered.

“Just wanna sleep,” he answered, squeezing his eyes shut and opening them wide. “It’ll fuck up my internal clock, though.”

Phil shrugged. “Going to sleep around nine might not be such a bad thing. You might wake up before noon, go out and have a productive morning,” he offered with a slight laugh.

Dan appeared to be listening, but not actually hearing anything. He stood up slowly – even in his exhausted state he was aware of the physical consequences of pushing himself up too fast. “Gonna shower,” he decided, silently shuffling from the lounge to the bathroom.

“Are you sure?” Phil got up and tailed after him – which at the snail’s pace Dan was moving at, was not very difficult. “You’re so tired, I don’t want you to fall and hurt yourself. I really think you should just take a bath instead…”

“I’m fine,” Dan insisted, annoyance in his tone. Despite Phil’s protests, he closed the door to the bathroom, and the sound of water running could be heard from the outside.

Luckily, that night did not end in tragedy. Dan had been in bed by ten but had still ended up sleeping well into the next day. Phil, however, was up much later, preoccupied with worry.

2/14/12 – 3:54 PM

What had started out as a lovely holiday had gone sour rapidly. The morning was great – a long pancake breakfast in front of the tv, calm, pleasant conversation, an exchange of homemade cards because – despite everything – they couldn’t resist being cheesy. All was well.

Then Phil suggested going out for dinner, and all hell broke loose.

“Have you lost your fucking mind?” it looked like a blood vessel could pop at any moment. “We can’t go out on Valentine’s Day. Everyone is out on a fucking date. Do you know how easily we could be spotted? How much it would blow up if we were?” Dan shook his head, getting up and pacing around. “We have more eyes on us than ever before. You got recognized twice getting cereal from fucking Tesco’s!”

Phil was taken aback, but quickly went from being hurt at the refusal to angry at the overreaction. “What the hell is your problem? Yeah, okay, we might be recognized if we go out. Are we supposed to stay inside for the rest of our lives? Am I supposed to act like I barely know you if we go out together?”

“Why are you being so selfish?” Dan snapped. “Can’t you stop thinking about what you want now long enough to think about what it could mean for our future?”

“I’m being selfish? You’re the one that’s so caught up in how strangers on the internet see you that you’ve stopped giving a shit about anyone else’s feelings!” Phil gritted his teeth. “I should be allowed to express how I feel about you without having to look over my shoulder every minute!”

“Then why don’t you go upload another video about it?” and with that, Dan stormed off and slammed the door to his room.

12/15/12 – 2:33 AM

“Phil?” Dan knocked on the door, voice meek. “Are you awake?”

There was silence, but just before he was about to retreat into his room, he heard a gruff “Yeah.”

Dan sheepishly padded into Phil’s bedroom and sat down at the edge of the bed. He stared at the floor without speaking for another moment. “I’m sorry. I took out a lot of stress and anger out on you before and totally ruined Valentine’s Day,” he sighed, fidgeting with the hem of his t-shirt. “You don’t have to forgive me. I just wanted you to know that I know I was a dick.”

Phil smiled weakly, sitting up and reaching out to take Dan’s hand. “It was a dick move, but you’re not a dick,” he told him. “Maybe I shouldn’t have pushed for going out anyway, we’d have to wait at least an hour anywhere we went,” he offered.

“No, no. I can’t let you take any fault for this. I fucked up,” Dan insisted, then paused for a moment. “Maybe we shouldn’t be doing this right now…”

“What do you mean?”

Dan sighed. “I don’t know if now is the right time to be in an exclusive relationship. We have so much going on with videos and conventions, worrying about ‘us’ is just another thing that’ll stress us out,” he explained.

Phil frowned, letting go of Dan’s hand. “Are you breaking up with me?” he held one of his pillows to his chest, trying to ignore the feeling that his world was crashing down around him.

“No, not exactly,” Dan got up and started to walk back and forth as he searched for his words. “I’m just saying that until we get more settled, until we don’t have so much on our plates, we should just…take a break from being a couple. That way we won’t have to worry about hiding this big secret from our audience.”

Silence refilled the room as Phil mulled over what Dan said. As much as he hated the idea of not being with him, he couldn’t argue his points. Dan had seemed so on edge, on the brink of breaking. Maybe he was right, maybe a relationship was just an additional thing they needed to juggle in their increasingly busy lives. “I guess you have a point. Besides, everyone likes the dynamic we have as friends. It could work like that,” he didn’t seem to fully believe his own words, but was willing to try.

“See, I knew you’d get it,” he smiled, seeming to relax. “I think we’ll be all the stronger for it,” he walked over and squeezed his shoulder. “Thank you for being so understanding.”

Phil pat his hand and nodded. “It’s worth a shot. Now get to sleep, it’s late,” he told him before laying down and rolling over. He listened to his door open and close, and for Dan’s door to do the same. He buried his face in his pillow and let out a frustrated sob, tears dropping from his eyes and to the pillowcase. As much as he suspected this would happen, and that it may even be for the best, he couldn’t stop the hurt he felt.

2/25/12 – 12:47 PM

Phil stood with his phone in his hand, brows furrowed. “I still think this is a stupid idea,” he mumbled, but continued typing away.

“Oh, come on, it could be fun,” Dan retorted. “Besides, if nothing else, we can get some funny stories out of it,” he held up his phone, showing Phil his camera roll. “Which one should be the profile picture? I want something that says, ‘puts effort into his appearance without trying too hard’,” he hummed.

Not enough time had passed for this, Phil felt. It hadn’t even been two weeks since their unofficial breakup and there they were, making dating profiles on OkCupid. He had been opposed to the idea from the beginning, but Dan had been insistent that it was a good idea. Phil relented, deciding that just because he downloaded the app didn’t mean he had to go on a bunch of dates, though he winced at the idea of Dan doing so. “I like the third one in the second row,” he told him with a shrug, before returning to his own profile. He liked the personality quizzes, if nothing else. “Okay, I think I’m done.”

Dan looked up and grinned. “See? That wasn’t so bad. You’ll be spammed with inappropriate messages in no time,” he teased. “Good thing most of our viewers are under eighteen, that’d make things so much worse,” he chuckled, scrolling through recommended profiles.

“I think you’d like your ego stroked a little bit,” Phil retorted, shoving his phone into his pocket and getting up from the couch. “Do we have food?” he asked as he made his way into the kitchen and began rifling through the refrigerator.

“Should have some leftover Indian takeaway,” Dan shrugged, attention more on the messages he was starting to receive. As far as he was concerned, this was an obvious solution – they could date and sleep around, get their needs fulfilled, and keep making videos and have the appearance of normal best friends. Besides, Phil had so much more to offer in a relationship – he doubted he’d even need him after a while. “Save some for me, though. I don’t feel like cooking.”

Phil heated up a plate of food in the microwave. “There’s plenty left,” he assured. When his food was ready, he went and set at the table to eat. He scrolled aimlessly through OkCupid profiles as he ate, then tapped on Dan’s profile when he stumbled upon it. They were a 99% match, go figure.

2/29/12 – 3:08 AM

Phil was a light sleeper. It was never more than a minor inconvenience growing up, though it made for some unpleasant nights at university. Sometimes it led him to scold Dan for staying up until four in the morning, because he could hear him playing video games through the wall. Though tonight, he would have much preferred it was video games.

Instead, he heard Dan having sex with the guy he’d brought back to the flat about an hour before. He found it ironic, in a way, that the first person he hooked up with from the website was a man, considering he had been so preoccupied with coming off as ‘gay’ to his audience. The noises were muffled, leading Phil to believe he was trying to be quiet by hiding his face in the pillow – a courtesy he appreciated.

Phil tossed and turned as he tried to get himself back to sleep, but he was far too distracted by what was going on in the next room. He got up, rifling through his nightstand for earplugs, putting them in and laying back down. With the sounds drowning out, he let himself drift back off to sleep.

When the morning came, the man was gone, and Dan was sitting at the table, eating breakfast like nothing had happened. Phil had expected that they would start seeing other people eventually, but he wasn’t ready for it to be so soon. He sure as hell wasn’t ready to bring home a one-night stand, and almost resented Dan for jumping in bed with someone else.

“Have fun last night?” he asked dryly.

Dan blushed, looking down at his bowl of cereal. “You uh…were awake? I was trying to be discreet,” he mumbled.

“Thin walls, Dan. I was a little surprised, is all,” Phil was doing his damnedest to seem unaffected. The last thing he wanted was to come off as jealous or needy – he was a grown man, he wasn’t supposed to cling to someone that clearly wanted space.

“Just needed a distraction. You don’t have to think when you’re running on endorphins,” Dan explained. Apart from Phil, he had always found it easy to detach emotions from sex. To him, sex was an activity that could be used to relieve stress, the same way someone would go for a run or smoke weed – both things he had tried and quickly decided he was not a fan of.

Phil shrugged, helping himself to a bowl of Dan’s cereal. “You don’t have to defend yourself.”

“You sure you’re not bothered by it?”

“Doesn’t really matter now does it? This is what you wanted, and I’m a big boy, I’ll cope just fine,” Phil’s tone was a bit harsher than he intended, so he tried to offset it. “Maybe I’m just jealous that it’s so easy for you to score,” he joked.

Dan rolled his eyes. “It’d be easy for you too if you weren’t so picky. It’s just sex – find someone hot and put your penis in them,” it may have come off as a bit odd for him to be so insistent on Phil seeing other people as well, but deep down he knew he was trying to alleviate his conscience of guilt for putting them in that situation in the first place.

“You make it sound so appealing,” Phil laughed. “Okay, I’ll try lowering my standards a little bit,” it could be fun, he thought. He was overdue for a bit of fun.

And when he did get an attractive stranger in his bed that night, he felt satisfied in the moment – it was good sex. But falling asleep alone made him question if it was worth it.

Dan sighed. “I don’t know if now is the right time to be in an exclusive relationship. We have so much going on with videos and conventions, worrying about ‘us’ is just another thing that’ll stress us out,” he explained.

Phil frowned, letting go of Dan’s hand. “Are you breaking up with me?” he held one of his pillows to his chest, trying to ignore the feeling that his world was crashing down around him.

“No, not exactly,” Dan got up and started to walk back and forth as he searched for his words. “I’m just saying that until we get more settled, until we don’t have so much on our plates, we should just…take a break from being a couple. That way we won’t have to worry about hiding this big secret from our audience.”

Silence refilled the room as Phil mulled over what Dan said. As much as he hated the idea of not being with him, he couldn’t argue his points. Dan had seemed so on edge, on the brink of breaking. Maybe he was right, maybe a relationship was just an additional thing they needed to juggle in their increasingly busy lives. “I guess you have a point. Besides, everyone likes the dynamic we have as friends. It could work like that,” he didn’t seem to fully believe his own words, but was willing to try.

“See, I knew you’d get it,” he smiled, seeming to relax. “I think we’ll be all the stronger for it,” he walked over and squeezed his shoulder. “Thank you for being so understanding.”

Phil pat his hand and nodded. “It’s worth a shot. Now get to sleep, it’s late,” he told him before laying down and rolling over. He listened to his door open and close, and for Dan’s door to do the same. He buried his face in his pillow and let out a frustrated sob, tears dropping from his eyes and to the pillowcase. As much as he suspected this would happen, and that it may even be for the best, he couldn’t stop the hurt he felt.

Phil stood with his phone in his hand, brows furrowed. “I still think this is a stupid idea,” he mumbled, but continued typing away.

“Oh, come on, it could be fun,” Dan retorted. “Besides, if nothing else, we can get some funny stories out of it,” he held up his phone, showing Phil his camera roll. “Which one should be the profile picture? I want something that says, ‘puts effort into his appearance without trying too hard’,” he hummed.

Not enough time had passed for this, Phil felt. It hadn’t even been two weeks since their unofficial breakup and there they were, making dating profiles on OkCupid. He had been opposed to the idea from the beginning, but Dan had been insistent that it was a good idea. Phil relented, deciding that just because he downloaded the app didn’t mean he had to go on a bunch of dates, though he winced at the idea of Dan doing so. “I like the third one in the second row,” he told him with a shrug, before returning to his own profile. He liked the personality quizzes, if nothing else. “Okay, I think I’m done.”

Dan looked up and grinned. “See? That wasn’t so bad. You’ll be spammed with inappropriate messages in no time,” he teased. “Good thing most of our viewers are under eighteen, that’d make things so much worse,” he chuckled, scrolling through recommended profiles.

“I think you’d like your ego stroked a little bit,” Phil retorted, shoving his phone into his pocket and getting up from the couch. “Do we have food?” he asked as he made his way into the kitchen and began rifling through the refrigerator.

“Should have some leftover Indian takeaway,” Dan shrugged, attention more on the messages he was starting to receive. As far as he was concerned, this was an obvious solution – they could date and sleep around, get their needs fulfilled, and keep making videos and have the appearance of normal best friends. Besides, Phil had so much more to offer in a relationship – he doubted he’d even need him after a while. “Save some for me, though. I don’t feel like cooking.”

Phil heated up a plate of food in the microwave. “There’s plenty left,” he assured. When his food was ready, he went and set at the table to eat. He scrolled aimlessly through OkCupid profiles as he ate, then tapped on Dan’s profile when he stumbled upon it. They were a 99% match, go figure.

2/29/12 – 3:08 AM

Phil was a light sleeper. It was never more than a minor inconvenience growing up, though it made for some unpleasant nights at university. Sometimes it led him to scold Dan for staying up until four in the morning, because he could hear him playing video games through the wall. Though tonight, he would have much preferred it was video games.

Instead, he heard Dan having sex with the guy he’d brought back to the flat about an hour before. He found it ironic, in a way, that the first person he hooked up with from the website was a man, considering he had been so preoccupied with coming off as ‘gay’ to his audience. The noises were muffled, leading Phil to believe he was trying to be quiet by hiding his face in the pillow – a courtesy he appreciated.

Phil tossed and turned as he tried to get himself back to sleep, but he was far too distracted by what was going on in the next room. He got up, rifling through his nightstand for earplugs, putting them in and laying back down. With the sounds drowning out, he let himself drift back off to sleep.

When the morning came, the man was gone, and Dan was sitting at the table, eating breakfast like nothing had happened. Phil had expected that they would start seeing other people eventually, but he wasn’t ready for it to be so soon. He sure as hell wasn’t ready to bring home a one-night stand, and almost resented Dan for jumping in bed with someone else.

“Have fun last night?” he asked dryly.

Dan blushed, looking down at his bowl of cereal. “You uh…were awake? I was trying to be discreet,” he mumbled.

“Thin walls, Dan. I was a little surprised, is all,” Phil was doing his damnedest to seem unaffected. The last thing he wanted was to come off as jealous or needy – he was a grown man, he wasn’t supposed to cling to someone that clearly wanted space.

“Just needed a distraction. You don’t have to think when you’re running on endorphins,” Dan explained. Apart from Phil, he had always found it easy to detach emotions from sex. To him, sex was an activity that could be used to relieve stress, the same way someone would go for a run or smoke weed – both things he had tried and quickly decided he was not a fan of.

Phil shrugged, helping himself to a bowl of Dan’s cereal. “You don’t have to defend yourself.”

“You sure you’re not bothered by it?”

“Doesn’t really matter now does it? This is what you wanted, and I’m a big boy, I’ll cope just fine,” Phil’s tone was a bit harsher than he intended, so he tried to offset it. “Maybe I’m just jealous that it’s so easy for you to score,” he joked.

Dan rolled his eyes. “It’d be easy for you too if you weren’t so picky. It’s just sex – find someone hot and put your penis in them,” it may have come off as a bit odd for him to be so insistent on Phil seeing other people as well, but deep down he knew he was trying to alleviate his conscience of guilt for putting them in that situation in the first place.

“You make it sound so appealing,” Phil laughed. “Okay, I’ll try lowering my standards a little bit,” it could be fun, he thought. He was overdue for a bit of fun.

And when he did get an attractive stranger in his bed that night, he felt satisfied in the moment – it was good sex. But falling asleep alone made him question if it was worth it.

Phil shrugged. “Going to sleep around nine might not be such a bad thing. You might wake up before noon, go out and have a productive morning,” he offered with a slight laugh.

“Doesn’t really matter now does it? This is what you wanted, and I’m a big boy, I’ll cope just fine,” Phil’s tone was a bit harsher than he intended, so he tried to offset it. “Maybe I’m just jealous that it’s so easy for you to score,” he joked.

Dan rolled his eyes. “It’d be easy for you too if you weren’t so picky. It’s just sex – find someone hot and put your penis in them,” it may have come off as a bit odd for him to be so insistent on Phil seeing other people as well, but deep down he knew he was trying to alleviate his conscience of guilt for putting them in that situation in the first place.

“You make it sound so appealing,” Phil laughed. “Okay, I’ll try lowering my standards a little bit,” it could be fun, he thought. He was overdue for a bit of fun.

And when he did get an attractive stranger in his bed that night, he felt satisfied in the moment – it was good sex. But falling asleep alone made him question if it was worth it.
trail.content_abstract:
Title: A Year in the Life

Summary: Everyone writes off 2012 as the year of ‘No Homo Howell’, implying that Dan’s demeanor was linked to stress over his sexuality and relationship with Phil. But that’s only the tip of the iceberg - with an unsteady future, undiagnosed mental illness, and suddenly thrust into the public eye, 2012 was a tumultuous year, one that no one has yet to truly understand.

Chapter: 2 - February

Word Count: 2.2k

Relationship: Dan Howell/Phil Lester

Rating: E

Chapter Warnings: n/a

Read on AO3 | January

2/6/2012 – 8:27 PM

Today was a good day, at least it ought to be. They had uploaded the first episode of the Super Amazing Project’s second season, after all. Phil, for one, was thrilled to see all their hard work pay off in a video he was proud of.

Dan was just…tired.

And Phil could understand it, he supposed. They had exerted more mental and physical energy than they otherwise would for a video, even more so considering how important the premiere was to them. But Dan looked like he had the wind taken out of his sails, like his soul departed from his body and only a zombie of himself remained. He watched the younger male sit on the couch with bowed shoulders, seemingly unable to keep focus. Phil frowned, sitting down by his side and gently resting his hand between his shoulder blades. “Hey, do you want some tea? Maybe go take a bath?” he offered.

“Just wanna sleep,” he answered, squeezing his eyes shut and opening them wide. “It’ll fuck up my internal clock, though.”

Phil shrugged. “Going to sleep around nine might not be such a bad thing. You might wake up before noon, go out and have a productive morning,” he offered with a slight laugh.

Dan appeared to be listening, but not actually hearing anything. He stood up slowly – even in his exhausted state he was aware of the physical consequences of pushing himself up too fast. “Gonna shower,” he decided, silently shuffling from the lounge to the bathroom.

summary: Even though I never got to see them live, I’ve loved the last few months. It has been an up and down rollercoaster for me and...
body:
Even though I never got to see them live, I’ve loved the last few months. It has been an up and down rollercoaster for me and honestly seeing the ig stories and the videos and the little updates from everyone that got to see them, it made me so much better.

It’s going to be different, a good different I think. They are going home, I don’t know what the future holds, neither do they. But let’s enjoy right now. Fans sharing memories with each other, spooky week is so soon, freaking Pinof 10 is in two months ??? Gamingmas??? TBC dates ?? There is so much to look forward to.

But for now, let’s let dnp take a few weeks off. Not demand videos or live shows.

They just traveled the world. The deserve a few weeks off.

summary: I don't know who else ask... Based on the Instagram stories and live show, Dan and Phil had breakfast separately and spent thet...
question: I don't know who else ask... Based on the Instagram stories and live show, Dan and Phil had breakfast separately and spent thet evening separately too because Dan play video games. I worry... why they don't spend time together in India... Why they always in separate rooms...
answer:
I’m not at all concerned. I didn’t watch the liveshow (literally fuck rize) but it sounds like Phil said something about calling Dan about breakfast? 

In general, I think people are very quick to jump to conclusions, and tenaciously hold onto them, and spiral into the worst cases of what it could mean. So, I’m going to go way out on a limb here, bare with me, just to demonstrate that there are alternate interpretations. What if, say, they were sharing a room and Phil got up before Dan? Meaning they didn’t eat together? Anything is possible; we only get to see snippets of their lives – and they are snippets that dnp choose to share with us and control how the snippets are presented. I think that’s important to remember.

To roll with the idea that they are sleeping in separate rooms in India… idk about you, anon, but I’m a massive introvert and sometimes I just need to chill alone. Like, yes, I know that they say they introvert together, but I’m sure when they are home they don’t spend literally every waking second together the way that they do while touring – Dan’s got his own office and they’ve got multiple lounges ffs. Touring is so go go go and I can imagine that getting exhausting. If I were in their shoes, no matter how much I loved someone (whether it was my bff, brother, or partner), I would need some goddamn space every now and then and fuck yeah, lemme have my own hotel room so I can stay up until 4am watching buzzfeed unsolved without bothering anyone.

And we know that they are spending plenty of time together in India. We know they went out for drinks – and that Dan was sitting by Phil. We know they’ve eaten together plenty – and that Phil picks food off of Dan’s plate so he can try new things. We know that Dan knows Phil’s Indian food order by heart and knows that it’s all he’s ordered in ten years. And we know that Dan is fine with Phil being safe with what he orders and Dan shares his riskier, more adventurous orders with Phil. To me, that’s so cute, and that’s love. 

Lastly, I know nothing about the video game thing, but again, introverting is important. 

Although of course maybe I’m totally wrong and Phil is madly in love with Marianne (context).
